DataElement.preferredName: CDISC Domain Clinical Trial Participation Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indication of the status of a patient's participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A collection of data variables or metadata for use with a Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) data submission. Representative examples include Laboratory (LB), Subject Characteristics (SC), and Trial Summary (TS)._A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes._The act of taking part in an activity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A collection of data variables or metadata for use with a Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) data submission. Representative examples include Laboratory (LB), Subject Characteristics (SC), and Trial Summary (TS).

Concepts.definition: A collection of data variables or metadata for use with a Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) data submission. Representative examples include Laboratory (LB), Subject Characteristics (SC), and Trial Summary (TS).

Property.preferredDefinition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes. Interventions include but are not restricted to drugs, cells and other biological products, surgical procedures, radiologic procedures, devices, behavioral treatments, process-of-care changes, and preventive care.:Taking part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
The act of taking part in an activity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research._The act of taking part in an activity._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.: A place of termination or completion. This may be a primary or secondary outcome variable used to judge the effectiveness of a treatment.

Concepts.definition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
A place of termination or completion. This may be a primary or secondary outcome variable used to judge the effectiveness of a treatment.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.27 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002214. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Parted with; no longer held or possessed; incapable of being recovered or regained._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

Concepts.definition: Parted with; no longer held or possessed; incapable of being recovered or regained.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

PermissibleValues.value: Enrolled on another COG therapeutic study
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Separate Children's Oncology Group Clinical Trial Enrollment

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Separate Children's Oncology Group Clinical Trial Enrollment
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Independent; not united or joint.: An NCI-supported clinical cooperative group formed by the merger of the four national pediatric cancer research organizations: the Children's Cancer Group, the Intergroup Rhabdomyosarcoma Study Group, the National Wilms Tumor Study Group, and the Pediatric Oncology Group. The primary objective of the organization is to conduct clinical trials of new therapies for childhood and adolescent cancer. COG develops and coordinates clinical trials conducted at the 238 member institutions that include cancer centers of all major universities and teaching hospitals throughout the U.S. and Canada, as well as sites in Europe and Australia. COG members include over 5000 cancer researchers.: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.: The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Concepts.definition: Independent; not united or joint.

An NCI-supported clinical cooperative group formed by the merger of the four national pediatric cancer research organizations: the Children's Cancer Group, the Intergroup Rhabdomyosarcoma Study Group, the National Wilms Tumor Study Group, and the Pediatric Oncology Group. The primary objective of the organization is to conduct clinical trials of new therapies for childhood and adolescent cancer. COG develops and coordinates clinical trials conducted at the 238 member institutions that include cancer centers of all major universities and teaching hospitals throughout the U.S. and Canada, as well as sites in Europe and Australia. COG members include over 5000 cancer researchers.
A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.
